summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report summarizing an interview conducted on August 26, 2019, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons correctional guard from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The guard, who was not present during the incident, provided information about standard duties and stated he had no direct interaction with Jeffrey Epstein or knowledge of the circumstances surrounding his death.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The undersigned FBI Special Agent who conducted the interview along with other officials.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorneys
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorneys for the Southern District of New York who participated in the interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center whose death is the subject of the investigation.

events.title: Interview of BOP Correctional Guard
events.description: FBI Special Agent, OIG Special Agent, and Assistant United States Attorneys interviewed a Federal Bureau of Prisons correctional guard regarding guard duties and the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was discovered deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: The interviewed Bureau of Prisons correctional guard had been stationed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) since 2016 and was assigned to 'control' duties.
The guard was not working or present at the MCC at the time Jeffrey Epstein was discovered deceased and had no direct interaction with Epstein as an inmate.
The guard stated he had heard no rumors or information relating to Epstein or the incidents prior to or after Epstein's death.
The interview was conducted on August 26, 2019, by an FBI Special Agent, an OIG Special Agent, and Assistant United States Attorneys for the Southern District of New York.
